name: The One And Only Online Quiz | Thematic Fun | 10 Questions

questions.text: This very famous musician made a TV commercial for Southern Made Doughnuts. Who was he ?
questions.explanation:
Elvis Presley.

	The commercial was made in 1954. The rest is Rock'n'Roll history.

questions.text: Who was the only President to make his own clothes ?
questions.explanation:
Andrew Johnson.

	Andrew Johnson, the 17th president, was the only president to be an expert tailor.

questions.text: What is the only South American country with English as its official language ?
questions.explanation:
Guyana.

	Guyana was a Dutch colony that came under British control in the early 18th century. The name Guyana is a native American word meaning 'Land of Waters'.

questions.text: What is the only easel picture that Michelangelo ever painted ?
questions.explanation:
The Holy Family.

	The Holy Family, which is also known as the 'Tundo Dani' is on display in Florence, Italy.

questions.text: Who is the only American poet to have a bust of himself displayed at Westminster Abbey ?
questions.explanation:
Henry Wadsworth Longfellow.

	Longfellow received wide public recognition with his initial volume of verse, 'Voices of the Night', published in 1839.

questions.text: Which was the only book written by a general, to be blessed by a Pope ?
questions.explanation:
'Ben Hur'.

	Ben Hur was written by Lew Wallace, a Civil War general, and was blessed by Pope Leo XIII in 1880.

questions.text: This famous composer's only opera was 'Fidelio'. Who was he ?
questions.explanation:
Beethoven.

	The opera was composed in 1805.

questions.text: What is the only animal besides a human being that can contract leprosy ?
questions.explanation:
The armadillo.

	The armadillo is an armored mammal related to anteaters and sloths. It is nocturnal in habit and feeds on insects, worms and sometimes carrion.

questions.text: What was the only Laurel and Hardy film to win an Academy Award ?
questions.explanation:
'The Music Box'.

	'The Music Box' won in the 'Best Short Film' category in 1932.

questions.text: Name the only nun to win the Nobel Peace Prize during the 20th century.
questions.explanation:
Mother Teresa.

	Mother Teresa won the award in 1979. She was born in Skopje, now in the Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia. Her birth name was Agnes Goxha Bojaxhiu.
